intro: Comastoma disepalum, commonly known as the two-horned bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed sepals that resemble small horns, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are bell-shaped and range in color from white to pale blue, attracting various pollinators. Comastoma disepalum is native to parts of North America and is often found in the eastern United States.
